messages.body:
$MPW reported 3Q20 NFFO of $0.41 [up 28.1% y/y] vs est of $0.39 [beat 5.12%] & Revs of $329.5M [up 46.6% y/y] vs est of $315.27M [beat of 4.5%].

Div Yield: 5.64%

3Q20 rent collection rate: 98%

Guides FY20 EPS of $168-$1.71 vs est of $1.56

Collection of materially all current rent & interest due from operators expected in 4Q20 with definitive agreements in place to collect, with interest, the 2% of 2020 rents previously deferred due to the COVID-19 pandemic

US healthcare spending increased 8.8% CAGR & without a single decrease since CMS began recording data in 1960
$MPW I didn't listen to the earnings call, but report looked pretty good. Needs to break this down sloping TL though and get heading up again.
CFRA reiterates Buy Rating on $MPW & keeps TP of $23

$MPW Earnings Call Today: 11:00 AM EST 
Analyst Rating: Strong Buy 
Phone: 404-537-3406 
PIN: 7673146 
Webcast: http://mmm.wallstreethorizon.com/u.asp?u=199443

links.title: Medical Properties +3.4% on Q3 beat, robust outlook
links.description: Medical Properties Trust shares gain 3.4% in premarket trading after Q3 normalized FFO beats consensus and the REIT says it's collecting "substantially" 100% of current rent and interest due from tenants.Sees annual run-rate of $1.68-$1.71 normalized FFO per share, based on YTD transactions, the same as its guidance issued in July."Operating conditions continue to approach and, in some instances, exceed pre-COVID levels," said President and CEO Edward K.

links.title: Medical Properties Trust (MPW) Reports 3rd Quarter Earnings
links.description: Medical Properties Trust (MPW) reported 3rd Quarter September 2020 earnings of $0.41 per share on revenue of $329.5 million. The consensus earnings estimate was $0.39 per share on revenue of $320.5 million. Revenue grew 46.6% on a year-over-year basis.
